meanings.definition: Reflecting nearly all the rays of sunlight or a similar light.
meanings.sent1: The white clouds in the sky looked so bright and shiny.
meanings.sent2: She wore a beautiful white dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The white cat tried to hide in the snow, but its fur gave it away.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as white as freshly fallen snow.
meanings.sent5: The white walls of the room made it feel spacious and clean.

meanings.definition: The color of pure snow or milk; the opposite of black.
meanings.sent1: I prefer to wear white in the summer to stay cool.
meanings.sent2: The bride looked stunning in her white wedding gown.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a touch of white to the dish for presentation.
meanings.sent4: The white of the canvas contrasted with the bold colors of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The white of the paper made the colorful drawings pop.

meanings.definition: To make or become white in color.
meanings.sent1: She used bleach to white the stained shirt.
meanings.sent2: The sun will naturally white the curtains over time.
meanings.sent3: The laundry detergent promised to white even the toughest stains.
meanings.sent4: The snowfall will white the entire landscape by morning.
meanings.sent5: The painter decided to white the walls to freshen up the room.
